ITEM.szItemDesc: A relatively recent Russian manufactured AK variant. This model fires 5.45mm rounds.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Reckoned to be 15-20% more accurate than the AK-74 by some shooters. Discerning mercenaries should give this assault rifle a try. This model fires 5.45mm rounds.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A relatively recent Russian manufactured AK variant. This model fires 7.62mm WP rounds.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Reckoned to be 15-20% more accurate than the AK-74 by some shooters. Give this new assault rifle a try. This model fires 7.62mm WP rounds.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Agram 2000 has high marks and styling that make it popular not only with Eastern Block police forces, but their mafia counterparts as well.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This 9mm submachine gun is one of the sportiest we have to offer!

ITEM.szItemDesc: Fresh from testing, Australia's Advanced Infantry Combat Weapon, is the lightest assault rifle/multi-shot grenade launcher concept out there.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Aussies have solved the weight and bulk problems associated with merging an assault rifle caliber firearm with a multi-shot grenade launcher. While the hi-tech Metal Storm based launcher is compact, it still fires a big 40mm round. The AUG carbine is no compromise either.

ITEM.szItemDesc: An AK-clone; this carbine was designed for export to other nations.
ITEM.szBRDesc: While not as compact as the AKS-74U, this carbine's marginally longer barrel offers better performance.

ITEM.szItemDesc: More powerful than its predecessor AK-74, this rifle employs many of today's new technologies. Long live the AK-47!
ITEM.szBRDesc: Back to the future... The return of the 7.62mm cartridges. More powerful than its predecessor AK-74, this rifle employs many of today's new technologies. Long live the AK-47!

ITEM.szItemDesc: From the AK-100 line of clones, the AK-104 carbine is chambered for 7.62 WP.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Exported from Izhevsk straight to the regional/sectarian conflict of your choice.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This AK-100 variant fires the 5.45x39mm cartridge.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The world just could not do without another Avtomat-Kalashnikova carbine, this time in 5.45mm.

ITEM.szItemDesc: One of the new Alexandrov-Kalashnikovs on the market, this AR is lean, mean, reliable, and accurate. What more do you want, really?
ITEM.szBRDesc: This addition to the new Alexandrov-Kalashnikov family features an impressive rate of fire, sliding tangent rear sights with a U notch, and a fearsome black phosphate finish.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 5.56x45 has finally invaded Russia. Like the Beatles in 1962, it's new, but it's popular. The AK-108 is a NATO standard Alexandrov-Kalashnikov . Go figure.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Who says Russians can't use NATO ammunition? Not the Russians! The AK-108 is built for the 5.56mm round, and performs admirably with it's new partner.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Variant of the standard AKM. While making the gun more maneuverable, the folding wire stock is not as stable or comfortable as standard wooden furniture.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This version of the AKM comes with a spiffy folding stock. About as comfortable to put against your shoulder as a lawnmower blade, it's compact size still makes it ideal for paratroopers, mechanized infantry, and anyone wearing a trenchcoat.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Originally developed for use by APC crews, this AK-47 variant sports a downward folding stock for when swinging space is at a premium.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Designed for portability and versatility with BMP APC's in mind, this AK is the Russian equivalent to a walkman: trendy for its time, practical, and a cause of hearing loss.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Successor to the AKS-47, this select fire rifle is chambered for 5.45mm rounds and is known for its noise and large muzzle flash.
ITEM.szBRDesc: If the AKS-47 was a Walkman, this baby is an iPod. The modernized 5.45mm version of the rereleased classic comes in just as many colors as its MP3 companion, but is decidedly harder to dance with. That is, of course, unless you're an Islamic Fundamentalist.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This AK copy is not the most stable firing platform, but the forward grip gives you some extra control when it's time to rock and roll.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Despite being devoid of the trademark wood, this gun begs the question: "Does the world really need another Kaloshnikov knockoff?" Our answer is an emphatic "Yes".

ITEM.szItemDesc: The new AN-94 Abakan design enables the gun to "pulse", firing a very fast two bullet burst before the recoil affects the user.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Like father like son. This weapon was designed by the offspring of the immortal Mikhail Kalashnikov. Another leap forward in gun making, you can be sure to see it soon on a hijacked airliner near you.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Val assault rifle's integral supressor enables the user to hose down a room full of enemies in utter and deadly silence.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The tactical applications of a silenced assault weapon are limited only by the imagination (and moral inclinations) of the user.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This rifle will give you delusions of divinity on the battlefield. If you're looking for a sniper system that redefines the term "HEADSHOT!", then look no further.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Designed for extreme range in Arctic environments, the AWM is the last word in any long range engagement - and we do mean any. Firing the incredibly powerful .338 Lapua, this rifle's remarkable performance is rivaled only by it's remarkable pricetag.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In use with Russian elite law-enforcement units, this SMG fires the same armor-piercing round as the Gyurza pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This SMG is small and light enough for easy carrying, yet fires the powerful 9x21mm round. 30rnd mags available now!

ITEM.szItemDesc: Firing .338 Lapua rounds, this highly accurate rifle is a rare commodity indeed.
ITEM.szBRDesc: With a completely uncovered barrel that is free to vibrate in any way it likes, you'll be sending "good" vibrations downrange and on target every time.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The M4 is a high quality, very versatile shotgun, and is very popular as a police weapon, and as a civilian weapon for self defense.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The M4 uses an inertia recoil semi-automatic system which allows to the shooter to lock the semi-automatic action and switch to the manually operated pump-action mode and back in the matter of seconds.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Beretta 92FS is a slightly modified version of the Beretta 92F used by the US military.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Beretta 92FS is a slightly modified version of the Beretta 92F used by the US military. It features a chrome lined barrel, new grip panels and a lanyard ring.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A modified version of the Beretta 92, rechambered for the .40 S&W caliber.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A modified version of the Beretta 92, rechambered for the .40 S&W caliber. Features a redesigned slide, and removable front sight blade.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Italian designed and manufactured assault rifle, the AR-70/90 can be a platform for a dazzling array of attachments.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Yet another Kalashnikov-inspired weapon, this 5.56mm assault rifle has a quality all its own.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A solid Italian sniper rifle from the 80's, this gun has aged like a fine wine. Just pull the trigger and say "Ciao."
ITEM.szBRDesc: An Italian military exclusive, cousin Lester had to do a few favors so we could carry this exquisite piece of sniping hardware. Order now and we'll throw in some photos of Lester's trip. (Warning: Photos contain adult content. Must be 21 or older)

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Bizon SMG is chambered to accept 7.62 Tokarev box magazines.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Variety is the spice of life, try out the SMG in its 7.62 Tk variant.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Simple and reliable (if heavy) the A6's firepower was favored by American paratroopers during WW2.
ITEM.szBRDesc: An oldie but goodie with a high rate of fire, this classic belt-fed LMG will answer all your offensive and defensive needs.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Swedish SMG and its variants have been in service with the Swedish military since 1937.
ITEM.szBRDesc: No stranger to armed conflict, make this rugged 9mm SMG yours today.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Modelo C is a dependable 7.62mm NATO Spanish Assault rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The H&K line of rifles got their design and license from the CETME model, which speaks volumes about its performance.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Made by the Knight's Armament Company, the KAC SR-25M can be considered a match version of the AR10 rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Made by the Knight's Armament Company, the KAC SR-25M can be considered a match version of the AR10 rifle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A popular M1911A1 variant designed to use double-stacked magazines.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A popular M1911A1 variant designed to use double-stacked magazines, with up to 14 rounds of .45 caliber power.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The latest in the M16 series, the M16A4 features "flat top" receivers and Picatinny rails for increased accessory compatibility.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The latest model M16 assault rifle has everything the A2 had and more. With the built-in Picatinny rail system, it can be outfitted with all the accessories you ever wanted.

ITEM.szItemDesc: As the mini version of the M16, this weapon is small but deadly. Used by many armed forces and law enforcement organizations.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Small, light and deadly, the M4A1 is extremely effective in close quarter battles. If you like the M16, you'll love the M4.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Following a long tradition of high qualiy yet affordable hunting rifles, this piece is designed specifically for human hunting.
ITEM.szBRDesc: With this high-quality yet affordable bolt-action sniper rifle it is hard to miss your target.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Czech handgun for the famous 7.62TT round. Adopted in 1952, the CZ-52 is a powerful and accurate handgun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A Czech handgun for the famous 7.62TT round. Adopted in 1952, the CZ-52 is a powerful and accurate handgun. This weapon has been retired from general military use.

ITEM.szItemDesc: An aesthetically attractive, comfortable to handle, accurate and reliable sidearm made in the Czech Republic.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This Czech-made full-size semiautomatic pistol first appeared in 1975, intended for the export market. An aesthetically attractive, comfortable to handle, accurate and reliable sidearm.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A variant of the .357 Magnum Desert Eagle that packs the extra punch of a .44 caliber round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A variant of the .357 Magnum Desert Eagle that packs the extra punch of a .44 caliber round. Often used as protection from large animals and tourists.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In 1991, the Desert Eagle earned overnight notoriety when this .50 AE variant was revealed.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In 1991, the Desert Eagle earned overnight notoriety when this .50 AE variant was revealed. Massive firepower in a massive pistol.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Used by only the most elite counter-terror units, the DSR-1 is the future of pinpoint accuracy. This gun can shoot 5mm groups at 100 yards.
ITEM.szBRDesc: With a free floating barrel, muzzle break, aluminum hand guards, and a bitchin' futuristic design, it's one of the coolest damn things we've ever seen. Oh, and did we mention that it sports accuracy once thought impossible to attain with conventional firearms?

ITEM.szItemDesc: Just about as accurate (and expensive) as you can make a gun, the SR-100 can shoot groupings other rifles can only dream of.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Comes with muzzle break, forged barrel, 3-lug bolt action and adjustable match trigger. If you're planning on competing in the Olympics in-between assignments, this gun's for you.

ITEM.szItemDesc: 9mm Machine pistol designed for security forces and support troops.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A Chilean made clone of Heckler and Koch's MP5K.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Swiss designed, Chilean manufactured 9mm SMG.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Strongly influenced by the Sig 540, the SAF adds to the ranks of quality Subguns.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This model of the SAF includes an integral silencer.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This silenced SMG is just the thing for your next covert operation.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Originally designed in 1925, the High Power didn't see military service until 1935, and was the only sidearm that served for both sides in WW2. This one is chambered in .40S&W.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Originally designed in 1925, the High Power didn't see military service until 1935, and was the only sidearm that served for both sides in WW2. The latest incarnation, the HP-35, is in use today in the Belgian Military. This one is chambered in .40S&W.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The FN BDA 9 is the double-action version of the tried and true Browning High Power semiautomatic pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The FN BDA 9 is the double-action version of the tried and true Browning High Power semiautomatic pistol.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This futuristic and fearsome looking rifle is Fabrique Nationale's latest entry into Law Enforcement weaponry.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The F2000 is a gas operated, rotating bolt, select-fire weapon. It features polymer stock with bull-pup layout. It comes standard with a 40mm grenade launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A smaller, more versatile version of the widely used Fusil Automatique Leger, this carbine still packs a mighty punch.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The original "Right Arm Of The Free World", without the weight. Grab this 7.62mm spewing baby if you like your extreme prejudice on a diet.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A heavily modified FAL, its compact size, portability, light weight, and power combine to make this a formidable battle rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The FAL OSW is extremely versatile. Featuring picatinny rails and a folding stock, this carbine is for someone who means business.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The FN MAG was developed in the early 50s, and is still widely used today. It is very reliable and will work even in the worst conditions.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Nail your enemies to the walls with the FN MAG. With a fire rate of 950 rounds per minute, you can draw a deadly line of fire everywhere you need it.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The FN Minimi SPW (Special Purpose Weapon) is a lighter version of the standard Minimi, with Para type buttstock and rail adapters.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Special Forces version of the Minmi is smaller, lighter and easier to use, but can still kick major ass in every situation.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SCAR is FN's newest offering into the military armament scene. The "H" stands for "Heavy", and refers to this version firing the 7.62mm NATO round. CQC denotes the shortest version for fighting in dense terrain.
ITEM.szBRDesc: US SOCOM issued a solicitation for the procurement of SOF Combat Assault Rifles (SCAR) in 2003, and this is what FN came up with. Widely customizable and extremely durable; if ever a gun had promise, the SCAR does.

ITEM.szItemDesc: FN's latest addition to the SCAR family is the "L" or Light version, chambered in 5.56mm NATO. The CQC version is for MOUT or dense terrain.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The FN SCAR was designed to be more customizable than any other weapon, period. Experts agree: it's nearly perfect. This version is chambered for the lighter 5.56mm NATO round.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A red headed bastard step child of the Eastern AK-47 and the Western M-16, this Belgian beauty has an integral flash suppressor.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A red headed bastard step child of the Eastern AK-47 and the Western M-16, this Belgian beauty has an integral flash suppressor and a Swedish twin. In the words of Gershwin, who could ask for anything more... besides a lighter trigger pull.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This ambitious sniper rifle fires 7.62mm NATO rounds very accurately due to its bolt action and thermal shielded barrel.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The deadliest French representative since Napoleon, albeit completely opposite in its stature. This ambitious sniper rifle fires 7.62mm NATO rounds very accurately due to its bolt action and thermal shielded barrel.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Galil AR from Israel is related to Valmet M76. In fact, the first prototypes were designed from blueprints bought from Valmet.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Galil assault rifle is designed for heavy combat. Reliability and lethality in one package.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This is the shortened version of the Galil, easier to handle for paratroopers and mechanized troops.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is the shortened version of the Galil AR. It is easier to handle for troops that are used to work under tight conditions.

ITEM.szItemDesc: There are big guns, there are big, big guns, and then there's this gun. Bring shoulder pads.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Ugly as sin, but so what? Whether it's knocking the treads off a tank or popping an enemy combatant like a water balloon, this gun makes it easy to feel like God.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A slightly more compact version of the model 17, the model 19 gives you the same reliable 9mm Glock action.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A slightly more compact version of the model 17, the model 19 gives you the same reliable 9mm Glock action.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A bull-pup design of the AKS-74U in 7.62mm WP. This particular variant has a built-in GP-25 grenade launcher.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Groza is a neat little weapon, but not recommended for lefties due the placement of its cocking handle, selector switch and ejection port. This variant comes with an integral GP-25 40mm grenade launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Putting a silencer on this already subsonic rifle can help you keep a low profile and stay stylish in any urban combat enviroment.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Putting a silencer on this already subsonic rifle can help you keep a low profile and stay stylish in any urban combat enviroment. Fires 9x39mm Subsonic ammo that is highly armor effective.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The HK 23E is a light 5.56mm NATO MG and is of the same quality one would expect from Heckler and Koch.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The manufacturer's name says it all. We highly recommend the HK 23E. It's reliable and does the job effectively with 100-rounds in a Beta C-Mag.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Combine the best features of the G36 and the M4 with Hecker & Koch's HK416.
ITEM.szBRDesc: After fixing England's SA80, now Heckler & Koch wants to improve America's M4. The HK416 is available in both an upgrade kit for M4s or as a complete weapon with a HK made lower receiver.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A personal defence weapon designed to compliment the G11 rifle, the G11 PDW was rumored to only be in the prototype phase.
ITEM.szBRDesc: SPECIAL! Available for a limited time only: G11 sidearm prototypes with glow-in-the-dark keychain!

ITEM.szItemDesc: The G36 is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, made from mostly modern materials and using mostly modern technologies. The G36C is the compact version.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The G36 is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, made from mostly modern materials and using mostly modern technologies. The G36C is the compact or commando version.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The G36 RAS is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, made from mostly modern materials and using mostly modern technologies.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The G36 RAS is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, using mostly modern materials and technologies. Unlike the 'E'-version, the 'RAS' is outfitted with Picatinny rails.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The G36 RAS is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, using mostly modern materials and technologies. The G36K RAS is the carbine version.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The G36 RAS is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, using mostly modern materials and technologies. The G36K RAS is the carbine version.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The smallest G3 variant, the G3KA4 features a 12.4 inch barrel, but is still chambered for the same 7.62mm rounds as its bigger brother.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A smaller version of the venerable G3, this baby packs a killer right hook at both ends. The recoil of these rifles is almost as legendary as their stopping power

ITEM.szItemDesc: Not as bulky or heavy as other LMG's, this gun still has a rate of fire that will frappe an enemy in no time.
ITEM.szBRDesc: HK has blessed us with their new versatile, multi-role squad machine gun. This version is outfitted with Picatinny rails.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The latest LMG from HK is gas-operated, belt-fed, and air-cooled. An integral bipod and RIS rails give you lots of room for addons.
ITEM.szBRDesc: First shown in 2001 in London, the all-new MG43 continues HK's long standing tradition of fine weaponry. Comes standard with integral bipod. Since 2006 it's introduced in the Bundeswehr (German Army) as the MG4.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A large pistol designed to meet the exacting requirements of the US Special Operations Command.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A large pistol designed to meet the exacting requirements of the US Special Operations Command. If it's good enough for SOCOM, it's good enough for you!

ITEM.szItemDesc: This is yet another version of the tried and true MP5, by H&K. Chambered in 10mm, it's a compromise between extreme controlability and increased firepower.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The MP5A2's bigger, badder brother. Bringing the impressive 10mm cartridge to bear, this SMG bridges the gap between an MP5 and the UMP-45, and is choice in CQB!

ITEM.szItemDesc: A modern SMG for the old Tokarev round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The latest and most modern SMG for the 7.62x25mm round. Comes with integrated folding stock and lasersight in the forward handguard.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The MP7 is a compact submachine gun with folding forward grip and telescoped buttstock, and is designed to fire special, high velocity 4.6mm ammunition.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The MP7 is a compact submachine gun with folding forward grip and telescoped buttstock, and is designed to fire special, high velocity 4.6mm ammunition.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The MSG-90 sniper rifle was made by Heckler-Koch as a "militarized" offspring of their PSG-1 police sniper rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The MSG-90 sniper rifle was made by Heckler-Koch as a "militarized" offspring of their PSG-1 police sniper rifle. The MSG-90A1 is fitted with the barrel threaded on the muzzle to accept screw-on silencers.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The P7 pistols are known for their low barrel axis and slim profile, which makes them accurate and easily concealable pistols.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The P7 pistols are known for their low barrel axis and slim profile, which makes them accurate and easily concealable pistols. They also are somewhat expensive, but have a strong following among many shooters.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Quiet and deadly, this gun screams to become part of any covert operation you might have on the drawing board.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Leave it to HK to design a gun that gives new meaning to the phrase "silent but deadly." We love those guys.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The UMP (Universal Machinen-Pistole = Universal Submachine Gun) was developed by the Heckler & Koch company of Germany in the mid- to late- 1990s.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The UMP (Universal Machinen-Pistole = Universal Submachine Gun) was developed by the Heckler & Koch company of Germany in the mid- to late- 1990s.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The HK USP (Universal Self-loading Pistol) appeared in 1993. It is a serious combat/self defence weapon.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The HK USP (Universal Self-loading Pistol) appeared in 1993, designed to be a police and military sidearm. All USP pistols are built on the same modified Browning linkless locked breech action with patented recoil reduction system.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The archtypal pump-action shotgun. In three quarters of a century of production, it has lost none of its potency.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Few things make a potential enemy vacate the premises like a solid, reliable shotgun. Chamber a round in the middle of a crowd and watch em' fight to maintain bowel control.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Pancor Jackhammer fires 10 rounds of 12 gauge ammo in less than 10 seconds, giving a whole new meaning to the term "pumped full of lead".
ITEM.szBRDesc: As the poster child of auto-shotguns, the Pancor Jackhammer is proof that almost all problems CAN be solved with violence.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Finnish SMG from the 80's may be remembered from movies such as Cobra and Red Dawn.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Jati-Matic is sleek and easily concealed. Just squeeze the trigger harder for full auto!

ITEM.szItemDesc: This anti-material bolt-action sniper rifle comes from Russia. Its effect on enemy troops can best be described by two words: bloody mess.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In skilled hands this heavy sniper rifle never fails to deliver. And now it's on discount!

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Rugged and dependable semi-automatic, just watch your thumbs when reloading.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The first self-loading rifle to be adopted by any army, the M1 has seen service from Normandy and Guadalcanal to the Chosin Reservoir and Khe Sahn and beyond.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The M21 tactical rifle is the sniper version of the M14. An accurate rifle with good stopping power.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The M21 sniper rifle is a semi-automatic version of the M14, and is fitted with a longer barrel for increased range and accuracy.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Standard issue sniper rifle with the US Marine Corps. Highly accurate with good penetration and stopping power.
ITEM.szBRDesc: SPECIAL PRICE! The USMC standard issue M40A1 sniper rifle of the is being replaced by the M40A3, which means we are receiving more shipments of these babies than we can handle and they all must go! Get one for yourself, one for your old lady and one for your kid!

ITEM.szItemDesc: Wet or dry, Metal Storm's Surf Zone SMG will not jam. Just be sure to have someone good with electronics around to fix it.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Metal Storm's obscene rate of fire is always an attention grabber. Featherweight reliable mass firepower sells it. It makes sense that the Surf Zone is secured by an electronic fingerprint lock.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The M60E3 is a smaller, lighter and improved version of the legendary M60 light machinegun used by the US Armed Forces.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Always wanted to be like Rambo? Now you can! With the M60E3, you'll always look good taking out a drug cartel, mowing down local mob bosses, and stopping an entire invasion force on your own. Comes with integral bipod and foregrip.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Quick firing, ugly, and functional. The M11/9 is as reminiscent of the 1980s as bad music and cocaine fueled business decisions. Not to be mistaken for a M11, though.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A first choice among many on both sides of the law for close-quarters dispatch with negliable penetration. The 1200rpm cyclic rate makes for a lot of muzzle climb, so aim low.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Makarov PM is a post-WW2 Soviet Army pistol, and while it's not the most powerful weapon around, it's still fairly reliable.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Makarov PM (Pistolet Makarova) evolved from the post-WW2 Soviet Army requirements for a new pistol: more compact, more safe and with greater stopping power than the then-standard Tokarev TT-33 pistol.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A modified version of the Makarov PM, developed during the 1990's.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A modified version of the Makarov PM, developed during the 1990's. This model attempts to address the original's deficiences: small clip size and low stopping power.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Known throughout the middle east as the MAR Tactical, the Micro Galil is IMI's latest and most compact entry in the Galil family of assault weapons.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A redesigned version of Galil MAR, with a completely new, thicker and much better protecting hand guard, a carbon-fibre folding stock instead of a steel one, and an extra standard rail.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Little brother to the world-famous SMG, this diminutive devil deals death at 950rpm.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Mini-Uzi provides tremendous firepower in a travel sized package.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Mosin Nagant was the standard infantry weapon for the defenders of the motherland from 1891 until the late 1940s.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Used by snipers from Stalingrad to Saigon, budding Zaitsevs everywhere will love the Mosin-Nagant.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Versatile pump-action shotgun manufactured by the Russian arms company Baikal.
ITEM.szBRDesc: For decades, Baikal has been designing and producing exellent shotguns.

ITEM.szItemDesc: One of the newest handgun models in use in the Russian military, the Varjag features a frame made from super strong thermosetting plastic material.
ITEM.szBRDesc: One of the newest handgun models in use in the Russian military, the Varjag features a frame made from super strong thermosetting plastic material.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The best thing to come out of South Africa since Apartheid ended, you can be sure Nelson Mandela didn't have this one in mind.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This unique 12 gauge features a bullpup design, a rear feeding tube magazine, and a new forward-back pump method.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Russian monstrosity is a counter-sniper/antimaterial rifle. At nearly 2m in length, this rifle is also useful for polevaulting.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This Russian monstrosity is a counter-sniper/antimaterial rifle. At nearly 2m in length, this rifle is also useful for polevaulting.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Whether you're hunting deer or other snipers, the M82 is a solid bet. It has a reputation for staying accurate at distances well beyond 400 meters.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This sniper rifles comes with iron sights, adjustable trigger, and a rotating bolt. Designed in 1982, it has proven so formidable that it's currently still in service with the British, Canadian, New Zealand, and Australian armed forces.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Pecheneg machine gun is an upgraded PKM. It's currently in limited production and has been issued on trial basis for some Russian troops in Chechnya.
ITEM.szBRDesc: An upgraded PKM, the Pecheneg is slightly lighter and has a higher rate of fire.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The PKM is the Russian eqvivalent of the US M60. It's a universal MG that fires the heavy Russian 7.62x54mm round instead of the 7.62x39mm WP.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Around since the 1960s, the PKM is one of the most famous Russian MGs and is used all over the world. Now you have the chance to show your enemies that old school Soviet weapons are still superior!

ITEM.szItemDesc: Smoother than fine vodka, the Pp-93 is a favorite among Russian police and security forces.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A true machine-pistol, the Pp-93 offers compact concealability in a slim, stamped metal package.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Feared and respected among SMGs for its range and rate of fire, the Ppsh is the tommy gun's hulking Eastern cousin.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Known as the "Burp-gun" for the sound produced by its high cyclic rate, the Ppsh41 belches death at 900rpm.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed as a backup weapon for Soviet officers, the PSM is an ultra-light, ultra-fast weapon with low to moderate stopping power.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The PSM was designed in 1970s as a self-defence firearm for top commanders in the Soviet armed forces. It is an ultra-light, ultra-fast weapon with good stopping power.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This export version of the Chinese assault rifle attempts to further tip the trade balance in China's favor, but when all's said and done, it's still "Made in China".
ITEM.szBRDesc: This export version of the Chinese assault rifle attempts to further tip the trade balance in China's favor, although the annoying little features of this gun (no provision for lefties, high sights, and an odd selector switch) certainly earn it the stamp "Made in China".

ITEM.szItemDesc: Throughout its mass-production, the Russian made RPD underwent four model revisions, none of which included a select fire mode.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Its full-auto bark has been heard in nearly every corner of the globe. If you need a squad automatic, look no further.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Another product of Mikhail Kalashnikov, from Russia with love.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The RPK is essentially an AK-47 with a heavier barrel and stock. It can empty a 30 round magazine or a 75 round drum at 600rpm.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Please read the following out loud, in a gravelly voice: A Ruger Redhawk revolver, in good condition, with six bullets left.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Super Redhawk is ideal for sportsmen using a handgun to hunt big game, and is also popular among metallic silhouette shooters. This revolver is world-renowned for strength, safety, and rugged reliability.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Those crazy Czechs and their designations. This time, under their term for SMG there hides a full-power assault rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In case you want a 7.62mm WP assault rifle, reconsider your decision to get a cheap AK clone made in someone's backyard. Take this Czech rifle instead, it may cost a bit more, but it also offers higher quality.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The TRG-22 is used by the governments of several nations as their primary sniper rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Finnish Sako sniper rifles are known by their world-class accuracy and strength. Order yours today!

ITEM.szItemDesc: The TRG-42 is the big brother of the TRG series and is used as a long-range precision tool by special forces around the world.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The TRG-42 in .338 Lapua Mag will meet the demands of the most demanding tactical snipers.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Gunfighters from Doc Holiday to Bonnie Parker have valued the wide dispersal and raw destructive power of a truncated scatter-gun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Nothing else ends a gunfight (and leaves a terrible mess) faster. Get it for that special someone in your life.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 7.62mm NATO brother model to the SIG540, the SG542 is standard army issue in many nations.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Swiss-made weapons are the standard for dependability, and the SG542 is no exception.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Swiss 5.56mm rifle with removable bipod and integral flash suppressor, this one will leave your enemies like dairy products of a similar nationality.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A Swiss 5.56mm rifle with removable bipod and integral flash suppressor, this one will leave your enemies like dairy products of a similar nationality.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The shorter barrel of this SIG 550 variant is a heck of a lot more convenient in close quarters.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The shorter barrel of this SIG 550 variant is a heck of a lot more convenient in closer quarters. Includes flash suppressor.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The scaled down version of the SIG 550, this 5.56mm carbine is excellent for CQB, with integrated flash hider and removable bipod.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The 552 is a extraordinarily well made carbine. Equipped with a side folding skeletonized stock and a flash suppressor. Order one now and get a free folding bipod with purchase!

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SIG P210 was developed by Schweizerische Industrie Gesellschaft (SIG) in 1938-1945, and was adopted by the Swiss Military in 1949
ITEM.szBRDesc: The SIG P210 was developed by Schweizerische Industrie Gesellschaft (SIG) in 1938-1945, and was adopted by the Swiss Military in 1949. The P210 is a recoil-operated, locked breech handgun with slightly modified Browning HI-Power style barrel locking.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SIG P226 first appeared in 1983, and is the official sidearm of the US Navy SEALs. This particular pistol has been re-chambered for a .40 S&W round and has a Picatinny Rail.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The SIG P226 first appeared in 1983, and is the official sidearm of the US Navy SEALs. This variant has been re-chambered for the .40 S&W round and has a Picatinny Rail.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A modernized version of the P228 with a short rail.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is a modernized version of the P228. It is available in several different calibers (this is the 9x19mm version) and has a short Picatinny Rail in front of the triggerguard.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SIG Pro pistol represents the latest advances in modern handgun technology. It is one of the most reliable handguns available today.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The SIG Pro pistol represents the latest advances in modern handgun technology. Lightweight and requiring no maintenance, it is one of the most reliable pistols available.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Offering the same stealthiness but requiring less money, this weapon is a competitor to both MicroUZI and MP-5K.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Loved and used both by counter-terrorist forces and by terrorists, this weapon packs a significant close-range punch for its size and cost.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Like anything Swiss-made, it's finely crafted, dependable, and expensive.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Sphinx 3000 is more than suitable for competitive match shooting or service applications.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A reliable pistol of Croatian design, the XD is for use in harsh environments.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A quite reliable pistol, this is a Croatian design for use in harsh environments. Testimonial from Hamous of Metavira: "Me like that gun!"

ITEM.szItemDesc: The 9x21mm round used by this Makarov clone was specially designed to pierce Kevlar AND Titanium plates at 100 meters.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The 9x21mm round used by this Makarov clone was specially designed to pierce Kevlar AND Titanium plates at 100 meters. This long forgotten Russian Pistole is now the side arm of choice for the Russian Federation.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed in the 1950s, the APS is not the most accurate weapon, but is still one of the fastest machine pistols around today.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The APS is surprisingly fast for a weapon of its size, and is invaluable in mopping up any messes from when sh*t hits the fan.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This SMG provided more than fifty years of reliability and accuracy to British armed forces.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This SMG provided more than fifty years of reliability and accuracy to British armed forces.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A heavier barrel and integral bipod transform the AUG into a hardy squad automatic.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Otherwise very similar to the AUG, the HBAR features a heavier barrel, integral bipod and can use larger magazines.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A shortened AUG chambered to fire 9mm rounds in a tidy, bullpup configuration.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A shortened AUG chambered to fire 9mm rounds in a tidy, bullpup configuration.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A shorty snipersystem, accurate to 1 MOA over 500 yards. This small rifle fires a big bullet, and does it very well.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Looking for a lightweight, compact, accurate, easy to use sniper rifle? Look no further! This bolt action .308 is the size of a carbine, and packs a wallop, even from a few hundred meters.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Whether you're hunting deer or other snipers, the SSG-P1 is a solid bet.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Cousin Lester took this gun out shooting for the elk hunt last year...then he took it out when his daughter came home pregnant. He bagged both bucks at over 600 yards.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A compact machine-pistol from the Steyr family, this Austrian SMG features a compact, comfortable design that is easy to control.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The TMP is the perfect compromise between firepower and concealability.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Control riots with this 12 round semi-auto shotgun like never before.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is the US made version of the South-African Striker shotgun. The key advantage of this shotgun is its large magazine capacity, but it is slow to reload.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Major firepower in a mean little package, the Serbu Firearms Mini-Shotgun is perfect for home-defense or the ultimate hold-out weapon.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Want a cut-down scattergun in the worst way? With Serbu's Super-Shorty you can forgo time-consuming hacksaw work.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A new Russian military sniper rifle intended for elite units. It has an integral bipod. Maintenance on the barrel is important on this one!
ITEM.szBRDesc: We were able to get a few of these new Russian sniper rifles. Please state if you want a wooden or fiberglass stock. The Bipod is integral.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This quintessential Russian sniper rifle has proven its worth on battlefields all over the globe.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Dragunov has been deadly in the hands of snipers for nearly 40 years. The SVDS is the smaller, but heavier, cousin of the SVD.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Snaiperskaya Vintovka Ukorochennay, Short Sniper Rifle is a shortened variant of the famous Dragunov sniper rifle with bull-pup configuration.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This rifle is more compact and has somewhat shorter effective range than the SVD. It's also more silent since the muzzle also has a flash hider and noise decreaser.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The features that tamed the world's most powerful revolver cartridge make shooting the popular .44 Magnum load a pleasure.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The features that tamed the world's most powerful revolver cartridge make shooting the popular .44 Magnum load a pleasure. Add Taurus' rock-steady scope mount base and your favorite rings and optics to make your Raging Bull a venerable hunter.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Venerated by the same mobsters it ventilated, the 1928A1 is by no means a museum piece, having roared its way out of the roaring twenties and beyond.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Employed by gangsters and G-Men alike, the Tommy gun's status as an antique shouldn't deter modern users from making use of its firepower.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Developed in the late 1920's, this pistol was the official side arm of the Red Army in WW2.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Developed in the late 1920's, this pistol was the official side arm of the Red Army in WW2. For its time, the TT was a formidable weapon, with good penetration and range.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The large caliber Udar revolver is commonly used by private security agencies and other organisations involved in special missions.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A large caliber (12.5 mm) revolver with high stopping power, used by private security forces and on special operations.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed and produced in Singapore, the Ultimax 100 LMG line fires either drum or box magazines of 5.56mm ammo.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Reliable and comparatively light-weight, our ST Kinetics' Ultimaxes have been modified to accept 5.56mm Beta C-Mags. Comes with integral bipod and foregrip.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Capable of fully automatic fire, the USAS-12 is designed to provide sustained firepower in close combat scenarios.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Capable of fully automatic fire, the USAS-12 is designed to provide sustained firepower in close combat scenarios.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Valmet M76 is almost an identical copy of the Rk 62, a high quality AK-47 clone that was developed for the Finnish Defence Forces.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This Valmet M76 made from high quality steel and plastic parts is one of the best AK-47 assault rifle variants in the world.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A variant of the famed Finnish assault rifle, this model features a polymer body and is chambered for a 5.56mm round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Originally constructed on the AK's internal works, this hardy weapon can stand up to tons of abuse.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The VIS-35 was the standard issue sidearm of the Polish military in WW2. It is still manufactured today in limited quantities for collectors.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The VIS-35 was the standard issue sidearm of the Polish military in WW2. It is still manufactured today in limited quantities for collectors. According to some sources, it is one of the best handguns ever built.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Cheaper, lower quality cousin of the VSS Vintorez, this silenced gun can still be your best friend in any situation requiring stealth, firepower, and attitude.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This silenced sniper rifle is made by a company known for manufacturing aircraft cannons and anti-tank missiles. Who could ask for anything more? Oh, and did we mention it can go full auto?

ITEM.szItemDesc: Sometimes considered the Ferrari of sniper rifles, the WA 2000 combines high accuracy with great stopping power. Too bad they're no longer in production.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Now back in stock! The WA 2000 is no longer in production, but we were able to locate a few, and they're on sale for the low, low price of only $7940! Get yours now while supplies last!

ITEM.szItemDesc: Winchester Rifles have been knocking rustlers and varmints out of the saddle for more than a century.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Through range wars and gunfights the Winchester rifle has always been a solid choice.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The XM-29 is part 20mm magazine fed grenade launcher, part G36 5.56mm assault rifle, and all kinds of whoop-ass.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The XM-29 is a combination weapon, part 20mm magazine fed grenade launcher and part 5.56mm assault rifle. Both parts are assembled into the single one-man portable unit with a built-in target acquisition / fire control system (TA/FCS).

ITEM.szItemDesc: This 5.56 assault platform fills a variety of roles. Ever wanted to serve someone a lead salad? Point at enemy and pull trigger to taste.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Originally commissioned by the U.S. military, HK is now producing this 5.56 multi-role weapon for the highest bidder. Lucky you.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The XM-8 is HK's response to the USA's call for a new standard Army rifle. The BLC version is the standard, and offers a versatile array of options.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The new XM-8 family of weapons is spearheading the "next gen" infantry weapons movement, after the OICW contract went belly up.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Compact is a shorty version of the XM-8, outfitted specifically for short range engagements, notably urban ops.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Compact is a shorty version of the XM-8, outfitted specifically for short range engagements, notably urban ops.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Sharpshooter version of the XM-8 is the Next Gen DMR, featuring a much longer, match grade, long-twist barrel for accuracy over longer ranges.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Sharpshooter version of the XM-8 is the Next Gen DMR, featuring a much longer, match grade, long-twist barrel for accuracy over longer ranges.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Serbian conversion of the classic AK-47, a semiautomatic sniper rifle that is relatively accurate, yet antiquated.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A Serbian conversion of the classic AK-47, a semiautomatic sniper rifle that is relatively accurate, yet antiquated.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Russian made over-and-under double barreled shotgun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: One of the many finely produced sporting shotguns on the market from Baikal.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The G36 is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle. This non-export model comes standard with a built-in reflex scope.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The G36 is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, made from mostly modern materials and using mostly modern technologies. This non-export model comes standard with a built-in reflex scope.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The G36K is the carbine version of the G36. This non-export comes standard with a built-in reflex scope.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The G36 is a conventional gas operated, selective fire rifle, made from mostly modern materials and using mostly modern technologies. The G36K is the carbine version, and comes standard with a built-in reflex scope.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The development of this rifle probably went like this: "We take a bit from every other AR on the market, and mash them all together."
ITEM.szBRDesc: Influenced by a lot of different designs, the rifle version of the Indian Small Arms System is a fine Assault Rifle as well.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Competitor to the .50 AE variant of the Desert Eagle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A competitor to the .50 AE Desert Eagle, and a fine American piece of work.

ITEM.szItemDesc: French Army pistol with an unusual locking mechanism.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Discontinued when MAB went out of business. Buy while stocks last.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed to slay "monsters" in a single blow, the .50 Beowulf rifle from Alexander Arms will make you a legend in your own time; heroic deeds are just moments away - let the ballads begin.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Use what the U.S Coast Guard uses: they know what they're doing.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This SMG was in use by German police before they switched to HK weapons (around 1985).
ITEM.szBRDesc: Surplus weapons for the serious gun collector. The MPL was used extensively by German police forces prior to 1985.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The improved version of the M16. Modified due to experience from Vietnam.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The M16's deficiencies began to dissolve with this model. Ammo was now loaded with powders that produce much less residue in the gun action. Barrel, chamber, and bolt are chrome-lined to improve corrosion resistance.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The shortened version of the M16, favored by special forces in Vietnam.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Initially, the CAR-15 showed some problems. First, it was too loud. Second, the muzzle flash was also terrific. Colt partially solved this problem by installing a new, longer flash suppressor. This model was officially adopted as the XM177-E1.

ITEM.szItemDesc: You will forget the Desert Eagle and any "highpower" revolvers when you have shot with this one.
ITEM.szBRDesc: New CMMG 7.3"Pistol w/Four Rail. Features a chrome lined 1/7" twist, 5.56mm barrel. Other features include feed cut ramp, padded pistol buffer assy, sling adapter, and T marked receiver. Lifetime warranty.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This is a cut down M16 that has been made into a pistol. It uses a free-floating barrel and will also accept standard M16 magazines.
ITEM.szBRDesc: In production for over a decade now. This model uses the OA operations system which incorporates the recoil system into the upper receiver, eliminating the need for an extension tube or buttstock.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A large pistol in .45 Winchester Magnum caliber, made by Galena Industries.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The .45 Winchester Magnum version of Galena's line of Automag pistols.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This version of the Grizzly pistol existed before the .50 AE variant was made.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Grizzly pistols are based on the Colt 1911, as their looks already told you, but they have been beefed up to shoot stronger ammo.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A longbarreled .45 Winchester Magnum pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: If you are seeing red, do like Charles Bronson did: Pack this one!

ITEM.szItemDesc: This is a DMR-version of the C7-rifle, with built-in bipod and sound suppressor.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The C7 "Custom Tactical" is a designated marksman rifle suitable for the spotter of a sniper/spotter-team. Sold with our rugged Battle Scope.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Contender pistol exists in a wide variety of calibers, this one is chambered for .454 Casull.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Thompson Contender Encore is a one-shot targetpistol that can also be used for hunting, if equipped with a suitable scope. Chambered for .454 Casull, this is a most powerful gun.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The preferred backup weapon of big-game hunters, though it can be a little rough on your wrist.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Ruger Super Redhawk Alaskan is a snubnosed .454 Casull revolver, a neat "little" surprise to anyone who wants you ill.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A retro-style revolver, in a not-so-retro caliber.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Freedom Arms Model 83 Premier Grade may look like one of the very first revolvers that used cartridges, but it is quite new, and fires the all-powerful .454 Casull ammo.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed by Aimo Lahti, this accurate if heavy SMG is a well-made, elementary blowback weapon. In appearance it is very similar to the German Bergmann MP34 and the Soviet PPD 1934G/38G and PPSh41 which it inspired.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Suomi was used with great sucess during the war of 1940 against the Soviet Union, where this SMG showed the importance of SMGs to modern warfare. Manufacture of the Suomi ceased in 1944, but Finland used it well into the 1990s, when finally it was replaced by assault rifles.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A very special sniper rifle that comes with integral silencer, integral bipod, and fires subsonic AP ammunition.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Quite new on the market, the Russian Vychlop (which means 'Exhaust') coughs up something more substantial (and more deadly) than carbon monoxide. Comes with integral bipod plus Battle Scope.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Designed as a police weapon from the ground up, it was introduced in 1979.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A semi-automatic shotgun designed for police use and Hollywood action movies. For lighter loads and special ammunition switch to pump-action.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The standard rifle of the German army during World War II. Rifles made after 1942 may have cheaper furniture and fittings, but the Germans never went cheap on barrel, bolt, and action.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This well constructed carbine version of the Gewehr 98 was Germany's standard rifle during World War II. Price is for guns of later production runs, earlier rifles on order. Ammo in stripper clips can be found in the Ammo-section.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The R-1 is another beautiful design by Benelli, and uses comfort tech to dampen recoil. Also comes with a picatinny rail for easy scope replacements. This .300 WinMag model uses a 5 round clip.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Benelli R-1 is another semi-automatic competitor on the sniper rifle market, and a beautifully designed one.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This .300 WinMag bolt-action rifle uses straight-pull technology to make chambering a new round a bit faster.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Blaser R93 Tactical is another futuristic german design. It has a quick interchangeable barrel system that allows for changing barrels without the need to resight the scope. This .300 WinMag model is used widely by German and Dutch police.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A straight-pull bolt-action rifle with a futuristic look. Pull back pistolgrip to chamber a new round, but take care of your triggerfinger: the triggerguard moves as well, but the trigger does not!
ITEM.szBRDesc: The S&O Shorty is a straight-pull bolt-action bullpup design with a very unique action: to chamber a new round, you pull the pistolgrip. It's made for hunting, despite the futuristic look. And if you're hunting the most dangerous animal of all, then it can also act as a mid range sniper rifle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: In production from 1949-1968, this Czech SMG has been liberally supplied to revolutionaries all over the world.
ITEM.szBRDesc: An older Czech SMG that fires the Russian 7.62x25mm cartridge. It is claimed that it will also fire the 7.63 Mauser pistol cartridge.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This version of the SAR 21 has Picatinny rails instead of a fixed optical sight and built-in laser aiming device, so you can choose how to equip it.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This version of the SAR 21 bullpup assault rifle has several attachment points and is considered more versatile compared to the standard model.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Developed for Special Forces to enable using battlefield pick-up magazines, this gun is essentially a M4 chambered for 7.62x39mm.
ITEM.szBRDesc: If the Russians make some of their guns in NATO calibers, we can do it the other way around. Developed for tunnel-fighting and using AK-47 magazines, this 7.62x39mm M4-variant comes with a sound suppressor. Only very few available..

ITEM.szItemDesc: Made with a synthetic frame and with hammerless action, this is obviously a competitor to the Glock pistols.
ITEM.szBRDesc: If it is good enough for James Bond, it is surely good enough for you. Commemorative models available on order.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A hunting rifle using Germany's WW-II rifle caliber.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The bolt-action system of the old Mauser Kar98k lives on in this hunting rifle. Comes with a 7x magnification scope.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Variant of the AKMS, which is a variant of the standard AKM. Was made shorter for special units and paratroopers. U-shaped buttplate of folding stock allows folding/unfolding while a magazine is inserted.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This even more shortened variant of the AKM comes with a folding stock that allows folding/unfolding while a magazine is in the gun. It was developed for paratroopers and special units, and is quite functional despite the rather unusual foregrip.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A Colt semiautomatic chambered for the 10mm Auto cartridge.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Colt's entry into the 10mm pistol market. All you expect from a Colt pistol, and more.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SCAR is FN's newest offering into the military armament scene. The "H" stands for "Heavy", and refers to this version firing the 7.62mm NATO round. This is the sniper variant.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: FN's latest addition to the SCAR family is the "L" or Light version, chambered in 5.56mm NATO. This is the sniper variant.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Advanced Combat Rifle fires a small armor penetrating fin stabilized dart over a considerable range.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Prototype of a new generation of assault rifles, the Steyr ACR fires fin stabilized darts. This is the future weapon of choice.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SCAR is FN's newest offering into the military armament scene. The "WP" refers to this version firing the 7.62mm WP round. CQC denotes the shortest version for fighting in dense terrain.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The SCAR is FN's newest offering into the military armament scene. The "WP" refers to this version firing the 7.62mm WP round. This is the sniper variant.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This CQC version of the SCAR-L has been converted to fire the 6.8mm SPC round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This sniper variant of the SCAR-L has been converted for the new 6.8x43mm SPC round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Yet another version of the H&K MP5, chambered in .40 S&W.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The more popular of the new caliber MP5's, this is the .40 S&W version

ITEM.szItemDesc: Barrett's entry into the 6.8mm SPC rifle market. A strong and sturdy rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not what you usually expect when you hear 'Barrett', but rest assured that this 6.8mm SPC rifle has the usual high quality and precision of any other Barrett rifle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Bushmaster M4A3, chambered for the new 6.8mm SPC round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Bushmaster's famous M4A3, now in 6.8mm SPC. As an added bonus, this is the military/LE full-auto variant.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Robinson Armament XCR-1 is just another M4 clone in 6.8mm SPC.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Another new entry on the 6.8mm SPC market, the XCR-1 comes with a folding stock, which looks a bit unusual on a M4 clone, but works very well.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Standard sidearm of the German Army during WW-II. It is also known as the "Luger".
ITEM.szBRDesc: A somewhat complicated pistol for the serious gun collector. Be careful when taking it apart. Call us for spare parts.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The reduced snag version of the P226 pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Reliability and ease of use are key features of this swiss made handgun. Improved with the SIG-Anti-Snag system.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A version of the P226, chambered in .40 S&W, with rounded edges to reduce snag and facilitate easier concealed carry.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A stainless steel slide and the SIG-Anti-Snag system (for easier concealed carrying) are improvements over the standard version.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Dyneema UD full composite helmets provide the highest degree of protection at less weight than alternative materials, against both flying shrapnel and bullets.
ITEM.szBRDesc: "BOOM! Headshot!" Who cares? With this helmet you are protected from bullets and you'll still score with the ladies.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Produced under license by several companies, Dyneema fabric is 40 percent stronger than Kevlar.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Some wearers describe Dyneema fabric leggings as uncomfortable; however, stopping a bullet with one's unprotected groin would be considerably less enjoyable.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Dyneema UD-based vests provide maximum protection at an extremely low weight. Together with the high flexibility of Dyneema UD, this translates into high wearing comfort for the individual user, ensuring that mercs actually wear them on duty.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Very Light vest that still offers the protection of its Heavy counterparts. Don't leave home without one!

ITEM.szItemDesc: Currently in service throughout the world with Bomb Disposal Teams, the EOD Bomb Disposal Suit is a state-of-the-art garment specifically designed to give the highest level of protection with the maximum comfort and flexibility to the user.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The EOD helmet is a state-of-the-art garment specifically designed to give the highest level of protection with the maximum comfort and flexibility to the user.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Currently in service throughout the world with Bomb Disposal Teams, the EOD Bomb Disposal Suit is a state-of-the-art garment specifically designed to give the highest level of protection with the maximum comfort and flexibility to the user.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Unless you have a higly skilled explosives expert on your team, or have shares in a wheelchair producing company, this piece is a must for every self respecting merc.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Currently in service throughout the world with Bomb Disposal Teams, the PRO EOD Bomb Disposal Suit is a state-of-the-art garment specifically designed to give the highest level of protection with the maximum comfort and flexibility to the user.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Unless you have a higly skilled explosives expert on your team, or have shares in a bodybag producing company, this piece is a must for every self respecting merc.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Either as a companion to the Ghillie suit or on its own, the Ghillie Hood camouflages your most important piece of equipment: your head.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The finishing touch for your ghillie suit. Also usefull to keep the sun out of your eyes and as mosquito net.

ITEM.szItemDesc: High Quality Jute Thread is sewn directly on to Military BDU trousers. The sewn on Jute thread covers the back and the front.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Unless you plan to wear jeans under your Ghillie suit, these pants are a must have if you are going for a covert approach.

ITEM.szItemDesc: High Quality Jute Thread is sewn directly on to a Military BDU 4 pocket coat. The sewn on Jute thread covers the entire jacket in the front and the back, and has an attached hood.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Whether you are spying on that cute looking girl next door, or sneaking up to that perfect spot overlooking an enemy base, this vest will make sure nobody sees you.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The most demanding ballistic requirements can be met by a helmet made from a specially formed Twaron laminate. Its low weight makes it much more comfortable to wear than the traditional steel helmet.
ITEM.szBRDesc: One of the best helmets money can buy! Contact us if you want them in blue for that genuine "UN-look".

ITEM.szItemDesc: These leg protectors are made from high tensile para-aramid fiber.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Protect your lower half from small arms fire and fragmentation damage with a pair of Twaron trousers.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Twaron Microfilament in bullet resistant vests makes protective clothing lighter, more flexible, and easier to wear.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The use of Twaron CT Microfilament in bullet resistant vests makes protective clothing lighter, more flexible, and easier to wear. In short, the most efficient protection system on the market today.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Helmet has been treated with Compound-18 for added ballistic protection.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Catching a bullet high and inside ruins anyone's day. Prevent it with a C-18 treated helmet.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The tensile strength of these Dyneema leggings has been improved by a treatment with Compound-18.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Contrary to what you see in the movies, there really is no 'safe place' on the human body to get shot. These treated trousers are worth the investment.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Permeation with Compound-18 boosts this vest's capacity for resisting trauma from bullets, fragments and other battlefield detritus.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This treated Dyneema vest prohibits painful penetrating trauma.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A treated ballistic helmet, because your head is worth it.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A treated ballistic helmet, because your head is worth it.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Treatment with C-18 has augmented these leggings' ability to stop career ending knee and hip wounds.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Treatment with C-18 has augmented these leggings' ability to stop career ending knee and hip wounds.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The aramid fibers in this vest have been significantly strengthened by the addition of Compound-18.
ITEM.szBRDesc: C-18 has vastly improved the protective capacity of this armor.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Coating with Crepitus goo makes this item the ultimate in protective head gear.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Coating with Crepitus goo makes this item the ultimate in protective head gear.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Complete saturation with crepitus fluid bolsters the defensive capability of these bonded armor leggings.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Complete saturation with crepitus fluid bolsters the defensive capability of these bonded armor leggings.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Looking at a pile of alien amniotic fluid, my first thought wouldn't have been "Hey, I wonder if smearing this on my body armor will improve its performance?" There are rewards for creativity and improvisation after all.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Ballistic inserts, available seperately from Bobby Ray's, would be the perfect addition to this already formidable coated armor.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Keep your brains inside your skull where they belong with this coated helmet.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Twaron leggings dipped in bug slime - yeah, I said it.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Coated leg protectors keep your stock body in mint condition.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A liberal application of alien goo has strengthened the protective properties of this vest.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This crepitus coated vest will keep unwanted foreign objects from entering your chest cavity at high speed.

ITEM.szItemDesc: An alternative to ceramic inserts that is cheaper and lighter, but also a bit less effective.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Can't afford ceramic inserts for your troops? This cost effective alternative might be of interest to you: the T-15 titanium plate comes in different shapes and sizes to fit any ballistic carrier.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Not just for unruly kids with skateboards and spray cans, these kneepads will prevent unwanted damage to your, you guessed it, knees.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not just for unruly kids with skateboards and spray cans, these kneepads will prevent unwanted damage to your, you guessed it, knees.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This helmet will protect you from small caliber rounds effectively, providing maximal stealth. For those really quiet operatives only.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This unique upgrade kit can be used to upgrade any standard kevlar helmet to its stealth ops counterpart.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Upgrade your helmet today! From standard kevlar helmet to high-tech stealth operations head protection in no time! This kit includes all the necessary tools for such conversion.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This upgrade kit contains the necessary components and tools to convert a common kevlar vest into the state-of-the-art Stealth Ops vest.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Need a suit for the next stealth mission? If you already have a standard kevlar vest, all you need is this upgrade kit and a few minutes of your time!

ITEM.szItemDesc: All you ever need to upgrade your kevlar leggings to those used by stealth operatives.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Making too much noise while walking around? With this upgrade kit you'll mute your kevlar leggings forever.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This upgrade kit contains the necessary components and tools to convert a kevlar, guardian or twaron vest into camouflaged recon vest.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Make a light, camouflaged recon vest today! With this upgrade kit it's easier than ever!

ITEM.szItemDesc: All you ever need to upgrade your kevlar or twaron leggings to those used by recon operatives.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Uncomfortable leggings? No camouflage pattern? With this upgrade kit your kevlar or twaron leggings might become first class recon gear!

ITEM.szItemDesc: This upgrade kit contains the necessary components and tools to convert a kevlar, guardian, twaron, spectra or dyneema vest into medic vest.
ITEM.szBRDesc: You don't have to worry where to put the first aid kit. With this upgrade kit you'll get enough place for all important medicine you need in your vest.

ITEM.szItemDesc: All you ever need to upgrade your kevlar, twaron, spectra or dyneema leggings to those used by medic operatives.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Get this kit before your buddy bleeds to death and upgrade your leggings today! A serious medic wouldn't neglect this one.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This upgrade kit contains the necessary components and tools to convert a kevlar, guardian, twaron, spectra or dyneema vest into mechanic-demolitions vest.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Never enough room for your tools? Need an extra pocket for the remote bomb trigger? With this upgrade kit your vest will make a difference.

ITEM.szItemDesc: All you ever need to upgrade your kevlar, twaron, spectra or dyneema leggings to those used by mechanic and demolitions operatives.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Ideal upgrade for mechanic and demolitions operatives! More pockets for your tools and demolitions equipment will give you more satisfaction, guaranteed!

ITEM.szItemDesc: This upgrade kit contains the necessary components and tools to convert a kevlar, guardian, twaron, spectra or dyneema vest into field operative vest.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Spending too much time outside? Upgrade your vest using this kit and enjoy more comfort and protection than ever!

ITEM.szItemDesc: All you ever need to upgrade your kevlar, twaron, spectra or dyneema leggings to those used by field operatives.
ITEM.szBRDesc: No matter if you're a professional merc or a kid spending too much time playing outside - this upgrade kit is all your leggings need.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This cover will make your helmet less conspicuous.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Shining brighty helmets are history! One of these camouflaged cover is a perfect upgrade for your helmet.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This cover will make your helmet less conspicuous. It has additional straps which can be used to mount leaves or other greenery to it, providing better camouflage.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Let the grass grow on your head! The straps on this helmet are perfect mount points for any material made by Mother nature.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A sturdy large frame revolver for the .44 Magnum round.
ITEM.szBRDesc: I hate to say it, but Harry Callahan would've looked cooler carrying an Anaconda instead of a Model 29.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Another French quality revolver. Its only drawback is the smaller ammo capacity, compared to a .357 Desert Eagle pistol.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The patented Manurhin MR96 design is a revolution in revolver engineering. The grip - a long-lasting rubber design specific to this revolver - allows continuous firing of the most powerful loads without fatigue.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Yet another fine service pistol from FN.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is the civilian version of the new all-black military FNP-9, with the same qualities, of course.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Another pistol from FN. A little bit harder to control due to the heavy trigger-pull, but a bit more reliable if ammo of dubious quality is used.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A new service pistol from FN, this one is a true DAO pistol, which makes it somewhat more reliable, thought the trigger-pull may be a bit much for some people.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Announced in 2007, this new pistol is FN's latest addition to the civilian and law enforcement market.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Brand new in the line of FN's new pistols (Forty-Nine, PRO-9), this one is chambered for the good old and never dying .45ACP-round.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A sturdy .44 Magnum revolver.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Probably the most famous Magnum revolver, due to its appearance in the Dirty Harry movies.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Someone was obviously so impressed by the toy that he made a real one. Go Figure...
ITEM.szBRDesc: Formerly only available as a toy-gun, we can now offer a real version of this stylish gun. Beware of frauds at Ebay, people may try to sell you the toy for real. Only we offer the genuine article.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Mostly based on S&W revolvers, but with a few features of its own, the MR-73 is the backbone of Manurhin's revolver production.
ITEM.szBRDesc: A French police revolver in use with GIGN, the French counter-terrorist unit, which tells alot about the quality of this gun.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A stock with Picatinny rails (so that your M14 or M21 rifle can take advantage of more modern add-ons) and a replacable shoulder stock.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is the "Enhanced Battle Rifle" stock. Just drop your M14/M21 system into it, and mount all the modern goodies that do not fit onto the vintage M14.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This is the M14 barrel and action dropped into a new stock with Picatinny Rails, to take advantage of more modern add-ons.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not buyable at BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The M21 tactical rifle is the sniper version of the M14. An accurate rifle with good stopping power. Somebody dropped this one into the EBR-stock that was originally meant for the M14 rifle.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not buyable at BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The short version of the SDASS's predecessor as a combat shotgun.
ITEM.szBRDesc: An Italian shotgun for police/military use, especially useful in house clearing. It includes Picatinny Rails on the receiver and the pump-action handle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A new Italian combat shotgun with rails for adding specialized equipment.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is a new Italian shotgun developed for police/military use. It includes Picatinny Rails on the receiver and the pump-action handle.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A 10mm pistol based on the Colt Commander design, i.e. with a shorter barrel than the Colt Government models.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Produced from stainless steel and to very tight tolerances, the Kimber Eclipse is a high quality pistol. The Pro II is the intermediate version between the Ultra II and the Custom II, and like the Custom II, it can be equipped with better sights.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Commando Mortar is a 60mm caliber mortar, slightly lighter and faster than the M224.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Commando Mortar is a 60mm caliber mortar, slightly lighter and faster than the M224.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Product Improved version of the M203 fits a lot of rifles, thanks to some ingenious adapters that come with the launcher. Special foregrip available. Cannot shoot grenades of more than standard length.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Everyone wanted a M203, and now they can. The much improved M203PI does not only work with the M16 and M4, but with several European and some Israeli rifles as well.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This Russian made pump-action grenade launcher fires 43mm ordnance.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Compact and light-weight, this launcher can quickly dispense a variety of deadly payloads.

ITEM.szItemDesc: An underbarrel mounted grenade launcher for Russian made assault rifles. The GP-30 Obuvka fires 40mm VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades.
ITEM.szBRDesc: An improved model of the GP-25 Kostyor, the GP-30 Obuvka features a sighting recticle and a recoil buffer to protect the rifle to which it is attached. The GP-30 fires 40mm VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Anbau-Granatwerfer 36 is an underbarrel grenade launcher for most of HK's modern rifles. Does not fit the short G36C, though.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Need some extra firepower on your G36? This oversized pistol does the trick. Can launch all standard NATO 40mm grenades.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Milkor MGL six-shot 40mm grenade launcher is the world's first mass-produced multi-shot, rapid-fire 40mm hand-held weapon.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Milkor MGL six-shot 40mm grenade launcher is the world's first mass-produced multi-shot, rapid-fire 40mm hand-held weapon. The MGL can fire six shots in less than three seconds, making it essential in dealing with ambush situations and in urban warfare.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Light-weight, retractable 40mm Russian grenade launcher for the grenadier in your squad. The RGM Kastet fires 40mm VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Living proof that the "Russian concussion" wasn't just the nick-name of the foreign exchange student you dated in college. The RGM Kastet fires 40mm VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Compared to the XM29, the XM25 dispenses with the complexity and weight of having an integrated Kinetic Energy weapon, and is purely a magazine fed, multi-shot grenade launcher.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Who needs bullets when you have grenades? The XM-25 is the stand alone magazine fed grenade system spawned by the revamped US OICW program. To the enemies of freedom, there is still nowhere to hide.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Operating like a computer triggered Roman candle, Metal Storm's grenade system is perhaps the lightest and least bulky complete multi-shot launcher around.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The AICW comes with an integrated 40mm grenade launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The FN F2000 comes with an integrated 40mm grenade launcher.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The FN F2000 comes with an integrated 40mm grenade launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: This model of the Groza comes with an integrated 40mm GP-25 grenade launcher. The GP-25 Kostyor fires 40mm VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This model of the Groza comes with an integrated 40mm GP-25 Kostyor grenade launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The XM-29 OICW comes with an integrated 20mm grenade launcher.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The XM-29 OICW comes with an integrated 20mm grenade launcher.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A little known underbarrel grenade launcher for Heckler & Kochs older rifles. The drop down barrel can take NATO grenades of any length.
ITEM.szBRDesc: This is the German equivalent to the American M203 underbarrel grenade launcher. The HK79 is slightly longer and will fit only on older HK rifles. It can fire all NATO 40mm grenades on the market today or tomorrow.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The Rocket Propelled Grenade, or RPG, is a cheap, single-shot weapon. It's main purpose to to provide an inexpensive albeit devastating weapon against soft targets.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The Rocket Propelled Grenade, or RPG, is a cheap, single-shot weapon. It's main purpose to to provide an inexpensive albeit devastating weapon against soft targets.

ITEM.szItemDesc: The RPG-16 was developed in the 1960s, and has better range than the RPG-7.
ITEM.szBRDesc: Once your enemy sees your packing the kind of firepower an RPG provides, have mercy on him and let him run away in fear. Or not.

ITEM.szItemDesc: WARNING: DO NOT AIM AT FACE.
ITEM.szBRDesc: For the times when flowers just don't cut it: say it with high explosive rocket propelled grenades.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A top of the line RPG launcher with improved range and accuracy.
ITEM.szBRDesc: The RPG-27 Tavolga is a further development of rocket propelled grenade launchers, and is endowed with increased range and accuracy.

ITEM.szItemDesc: With this baby, you can turn a pool party into a BBQ. Literally.
ITEM.szBRDesc: With the RPO-A Shmel thermobaric rocket launcher, you can turn a pool party into a BBQ. Literally. NEWS UPDATE: We now stock the improved Shmel-M.

ITEM.szItemDesc: Sure, now that you're done with it, you're just going to throw it away. Whatever happened to recycling?
ITEM.szBRDesc: Not for sale through BR.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A standalone M203 grenade launcher mounted to a pistolgrip and buttstock.
ITEM.szBRDesc: After the success the HK69 grenade pistol had with the Special Forces community, Colt decided to issue a standalone grenade launcher as well.

ITEM.szItemDesc: FN Herstal's underbarrel grenade launcher for the SCAR. Obviously developed from the launcher for the F2000.
ITEM.szBRDesc: FN Herstal developed their launcher for the F2000 some more to fit it on the SCAR. Will fire grenades of any length and can use future medium velocity grenades.

ITEM.szItemDesc: A longbarreled standalone M203 grenade launcher mounted to a pistolgrip and retractable buttstock.
ITEM.szBRDesc: KAC decided to copy Colt in making some gear that makes the M203 launcher usable without a rifle. We have decided to stock the longbarreled version.
